intro: Vinticena cernua, commonly known as the drooping vinticena, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its soft, hairy leaves and showy, pinkish-white flowers that bloom in summer. It typically grows in moist, well-drained soils and thrives in partial to full sun. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens, though it is not widely distributed beyond its native habitat.
